poem:
Title: "Exodus of Song"

On Phuket's lips, fear's whisper ever spans.
Detained and released, they, of mirth and moans,
Band of dissidents, praising in foreign lands.
From Thai clutches to Israel's arms, unknown.
In a world tuned to Moscow's iron demands,
Music frees the caged, lets silence be overthrown.
Fleet, Bi-2, carry your protest's brands,
Voices are heard, even when alone.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Dissident rock band Bi-2 leave Thailand after Russia deportation fears A dissident Russian-Belarusian rock band critical of the war in Ukraine have left Thailand for Israel after fears they would be deported to Russia under suspected pressure from the Kremlin. Seven members of the Bi-2 group were detained by Thai immigration authorities last Wednesday on the resort island of Phuket for working without a permit. The band were touring in Phuket, a holiday destination popular". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
